data.text:
â¢ Expanded edition of The Long Rydersâ debut album from 1984.

â¢ Featuring demos and live recordings from the era.

â¢ “They unwittingly invented Americana but seldom receive credit for it.” MOJO

â¢ “Few Bands have made more of an impact on the current musical scene.” Classic Rock

Released in October 1984 âNative Sonsâ was the debut album by American band the Long Ryders. Musically, the album fuses 1960s style garage rock and folk rock with country rock. Rolling Stone’s David Fricke described âNative Sonsâ as an album

“where Nashville, â77 London and the mid-60s Sunset Strip converge in songs of pioneer aspiration and outlaw bonding.”

This new 3CD edition compiled in conjunction with founding member Sid Griffin contains the original album alongside a raft of demos and a live recording from 1985.

Described at the time by Melody Maker as a âModern American Classicâ this version brings together all the tracks that defined the start of Alt Country with a new package containing sleeve notes by Anthony DeCurtis and design by Phil Smee.
